document.title: Mathematics Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

E35E5C58AE91434B863C661C59DC927C.description:
Create and write a word problem to match a given equation with a single variable and one
operation.

E0A64121FDC741BAB5163DDF07BC2AD8.description:
Use an expression with a variable to represent a given verbal expression involving one
operation (e.g., “5 more than a number” can be represented by y + 5).

F4B11A34BA50433ABB1A9A0E92692F49.description:
Write an equation (with a single variable that represents an unknown quantity and one
operation) from a contextual situation, using addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division.

6999677E9D2E4B88BC3BE3DD373730D5.description:
Describe the concept of a variable (presented as a box, letter, or other symbol) as a
representation of an unknown quantity.

220AFC0FC87845BA9861BAD6FA1E321D.description: The student will investigate and use variables in contextual problems.

66BC8824C3E74D80AF7CB3101AC6B621.description:
Solve contextual problems that involve identifying, describing, and extending increasing and
decreasing patterns using single-operation input and output rules (limited to addition,
subtraction, multiplication, and division of whole numbers; addition and subtraction of fractions with like denominators of 12 or less; and addition and subtraction of decimals
expressed in tenths or hundredths).

62904666BCC74D73A731055B5F64FF19.description:
Analyze an increasing or decreasing single-operation numerical pattern found in lists,
input/output tables, and function machines, and generalize the change to identify the rule,
extend the pattern, or identify missing terms. (Patterns will be limited to addition, subtraction,
multiplication, and division of whole numbers; addition and subtraction of fractions with like
denominators of 12 or less; and addition and subtraction of decimals expressed in tenths or
hundredths).

91AB9BCAC58D4C14B20C2885F9141E16.description:
Identify, describe, extend, and create increasing and decreasing patterns using various
representations (e.g., objects, pictures, numbers, number lines, input/output tables, function
machines).

8EBCB966F09D41269FD182335792E331.description:
The student will identify, describe, extend, and create increasing and decreasing
patterns with whole numbers, fractions, and decimals, including those in context,
using various representations.

62B064D3F89B4E6BBB20E80150EF72B7.description:
Determine the number of possible outcomes by using the Fundamental (Basic) Counting
Principle.

49F1C937BE11471A9DBF92D7041D5ACF.description:
Determine the probability of an outcome by constructing a sample space (with a total of 24 or
fewer equally likely possible outcomes), using a tree diagram, list, or chart to represent and
determine all possible outcomes.

A88F1A95E20847F885ED830118A4F5FC.description:
The student will determine the probability of an outcome by constructing a model of a
sample space and using the Fundamental (Basic) Counting Principle.

C6938FCF02FA4286963BFA12D4C70BDA.description:
Describe and determine the range of a set of data values representing data from a given
context as a measure of spread.

48703C76E19E4F2CBEF76A562032BECF.description:
Describe and determine the mode of a set of data values representing data from a given
context as a measure of center.

423EE8CAE5FE419191304DD9C7052C1A.description:
Describe and determine the median of a set of data values representing data from a given
context as a measure of center.

75571F81A3CD40C59DBBA4B117AA4C6B.description:
Describe and determine the mean of a set of data values representing data from a given
context as a measure of center.

D8EAF9F74DD747BDB5E3FB790C1F3755.description: The student will solve contextual problems using measures of center and the range.

14C9A7D56410497BAC16811E947A666A.description:
solve single-step and multistep addition and subtraction problems using data from line
plots (dot plots) and stem-and-leaf plots.

853FF0F8FFB14BE0B7BD756A9C507664.description:
draw conclusions about the data and make predictions based on the data to answer
questions; and

534B8A00CC86410597D178C52716AC0D.description: describe the characteristics of the data represented in a line plot (dot plot) and stem-andleaf plot as a whole (e.g., the shape and spread of the data);

55555EA539444F7194CBA28870AD6FDA.description:
Analyze data represented in line plots (dot plots) and stem-and-leaf plots and communicate
results orally and in writing:

1B6AAD38A06E4A4D8A5DD62D54B47B4B.description:
Organize and represent numerical data using a stem-and-leaf plot with a title and key, where
the stems are listed in ascending order and the leaves are in ascending order, with or without
commas between the leaves.

A0D51ABE9E37456A892589FC25886312.description:
Organize and represent a data set using a line plot (dot plot) with a title, labeled axes, and a
key, with and without the use of technology tools. Lines plots (dot plots) may contain whole
numbers, fractions, or decimals.

4A7459652FD84A4D8936E2B5C8CCBFEC.description:
Determine the data needed to answer a formulated question and collect or acquire existing
data (limited to 30 or fewer data points) using various methods (e.g., polls, observations,
measurements, experiments).

3B1C0096A0A2418586A54C920E541419.description: Formulate questions that require the collection or acquisition of data.

FCF8666A4BE9472EB7D58CB4BED61F90.description:
Solve addition and subtraction contextual problems to determine unknown angle measures on
a diagram.

B5B0CC04013442289F96A144E06AB527.description:
Use models to prove that the sum of the interior angles of a triangle is 180 degrees and use the
relationship to determine an unknown angle measure in a triangle.

8453F59E3B4B424EB77FED49DFECA5B1.description:
Measure right, acute, obtuse, and straight angles, using appropriate tools, and identify
measures in degrees.

63BD46E1AEAF40FEA29F274305DF201E.description:
Identify the appropriate tools (e.g., protractor, straightedge, angle ruler, available technology)
to measure and draw angles.

9B541DF80E374F61BDA9A0B0E357D2CF.description: Compare and contrast the properties of triangles.

96888087B3014D97B05F4AA37FF57670.description:
Identify congruent sides and right angles using geometric markings to denote properties of
triangles.

1F3CD91B65434D14AEE0AC78BB2A05A1.description:
Classify triangles as right, acute, or obtuse and equilateral, scalene, or isosceles and justify
reasoning.

CDEAFED6597444F999A0AB35646E63DB.description: Classify angles as right, acute, obtuse, or straight and justify reasoning.

A9C17CF70A66447C8DA7FB0510ABCF11.description:
The student will classify and measure angles and triangles, and solve problems,
including those in context.

699855AB1FEB434CB8A17C7FDF3B0AEE.description:
Solve contextual problems that involve perimeter, area, and volume in standard units of
measure.

B8FAC4EC0F3A4746911EC316A6583B6D.description:
Identify whether the application of the concept of perimeter, area, or volume is appropriate for
a given situation.

1FDE0AEE451747D6BAD0F7771AB8A7E5.description:
Solve problems, including those in context, to estimate and determine the volume of a
rectangular prism using concrete objects, diagrams, and formulas when the length, width, and
height are given in whole number units. Record the solution with the appropriate unit of
measure (e.g., 12 cubic inches).

92A7E79AB65843AEB7F2048A708FA072.description:
Investigate and develop a formula for determining the volume of rectangular prisms using
concrete objects.

E92F0B60750F4DC9B0FAADC467F1888A.description:
Describe volume as a measure of capacity and give examples of volume as a measurement in
contextual situations.

85184AE4AF0F4AC6A2E9AD1DA6A8924A.description:
Estimate and determine the area of a right triangle, with diagrams, when the base and the
height are given in whole number units, in metric or U.S. Customary units, and record the
solution with the appropriate unit of measure (e.g., 16 square inches).

72B5E09F4C7845E3A961EE563AE769C5.description: Investigate and develop a formula for determining the area of a right triangle.

FE491FE058AC40368F680AC4B69C34FB.description:
The student will use multiple representations to solve problems, including those in
context, involving perimeter, area, and volume.

9F693800E4244824A724228E88505DF8.description:
Given the equivalent metric measure of one unit, in a contextual problem, determine the
equivalent measurement within the metric system:

DB25CFB81D3848BDBA13AB93948D587D.description: Estimate and measure to solve contextual problems that involve metric units:

B589ACF2CA884A5797F059CCBB9A6C22.description:
Determine the most appropriate unit of measure to use in a contextual problem that involves
metric units:

93D924FE64F645D694B86561FEEFDD94.description:
The student will reason mathematically to solve problems, including those in context,
that involve length, mass, and liquid volume using metric units.

C2D98682BB624CF4A512E839D85DBE42.description:
Given a whole number numerical expression involving more than one operation, describe
which operation is completed first, which is second, and which is third.*

03F8EA15DC4C4D4B948A956A7ACD6756.description: expressions should not include braces, brackets, or fraction bars.

38E81E3F41774E8DACF76481EF2F1332.description: whole numbers will be limited to two digits or less; and

3DE78E4F8C42430285EE70D0333296FF.description:
simplification will be limited to five whole numbers and four operations in any
combination of addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division;

99FFA17E45424E2482386718D798675D.description: expressions may contain no more than one set of parentheses;

26C18B66753A49649A96AB194EC35329.description:
Use order of operations to simplify numerical expressions with whole numbers, limited to
addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division in which:*

FED54B2E2F134094BB51C3C07175B552.description:
The student will simplify numerical expressions with whole numbers using the order of
operations.

6F4A02F2DB5047AD97BC8431A60D304E.description:
Solve single-step contextual problems involving division with decimals by applying strategies
(e.g., estimation, modeling) and algorithms, including the standard algorithm.

D2B4D157FFB84720B30A21BB37893C4F.description:
Solve single-step and multistep contextual problems involving addition, subtraction, and
multiplication of decimals by applying strategies (e.g., estimation, modeling) and algorithms,
including the standard algorithm.

F3100A0A51A544F7B7C9ACBC32BD9A88.description: no more than one additional zero will need to be annexed.

12580F9FFF6C4E1699769CA5A00F598F.description: divisors are limited to a single digit whole number or a decimal expressed as tenths; and

A95DCB2DEDAA42AC9D53D51AC36A19F3.description: quotients may include whole numbers, tenths, hundredths, or thousandths;

53D9B785FA6A4E53B9E34DC63C212ACF.description: quotients do not exceed four digits with or without a decimal point;

FCE4716DB0A94F4AAF2B0120AACA0A12.description:
Estimate and determine the quotient of two numbers using strategies and algorithms,
including the standard algorithm, in which:*

D07A3B1B49B54D89A087FE1A8D3F97CE.description:
a two-digit factor and a two-digit factor (e.g., 0.85 × 3.7, 14 × 1.6, 9.2 × 3.5).*
(Products will not exceed the thousandths place, and leading zeroes will not be considered
when counting digits.)

180520CC3061499F81D0B1CCEEEC5754.description: a three-digit factor and a one-digit factor (e.g., 0.156 × 4, 3.28 × 7, 8.09 × 0.2);* and

EB1C70D7E5AD431F8541FD8BAC8C5738.description: a two-digit factor and a one-digit factor (e.g., 2.3 × 4; 0.08 × 0.9; .16 × 5);*

61D881B706BF495AA3329C69674D354D.description:
Estimate and determine the product of two numbers using strategies and algorithms, including
the standard algorithm, when given:

77882EE678174745AB02A81976BEF303.description:
Apply estimation strategies (e.g., rounding to the nearest whole number, tenth or hundredth;
compatible numbers, place value) to determine a reasonable solution for single-step and
multistep contextual problems involving addition, subtraction, and multiplication of decimals,
and single-step contextual problems involving division of decimals.

8C5B7E2356754996A24A51B46A6456BF.description:
The student will estimate, represent, solve, and justify solutions to single-step and
multistep problems, including those in context, using addition, subtraction,
multiplication, and division with decimal numbers.

9C16E1E0944F4AFEBBCAAE39F4D1F991.description:
Solve single-step contextual problems involving multiplication of a whole number, limited to
12 or less, and a proper fraction (e.g., 9 × 2
3
, 8 × 3
4
), with models. The denominator will be a
factor of the whole number and answers should be expressed in simplest form.*

5251930A17244CE2BC845DBBF257F7D8.description:
Estimate and solve single-step and multistep contextual problems involving addition and
subtraction with fractions (proper or improper) and/or mixed numbers having like and unlike
denominators, with and without models. Denominators should be limited to 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10,
and 12. Answers should be expressed in simplest form.

96B658F0FC8B4CB38ADEB9782E9A781B.description:
Estimate and determine the sum or difference of two fractions (proper or improper) and/or
mixed numbers, having like and unlike denominators limited to 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10, and 12
(e.g.,
5
8
+
1
4
,
4
5
−
2
3
, 33
4
+ 2 5
12
), and simplify the resulting fraction.*

9D952A89E32E47909DD47DFAF2F550E9.description:
Determine the least common multiple of two numbers to find the least common denominator
for two fractions.

6D0DE4438BCA42C383AC967F3B748CB3.description:
The student will estimate, represent, solve, and justify solutions to single-step and
multistep problems, including those in context, using addition and subtraction of
fractions with like and unlike denominators (with and without models), and solve
single-step contextual problems involving multiplication of a whole number and a
proper fraction, with models.

1450D506414D48C4B160FE26930DA87C.description: Interpret the quotient and remainder when solving a contextual problem.

96D7DD75EEB54D3E97B59D51F55DC827.description: dividends do not exceed four digits.

9FAEC3C540C84548A9FAB72ECC8C3013.description: divisors do not exceed two digits; or

C4104C3270714084905A693337E562A5.description: factors do not exceed two digits by three digits;

22DEF60EB4154CC0849DD8EC405DE2CF.description: sums, differences, and products do not exceed five digits;

CF4A168BFCF24D0A82D0400D07AC22A7.description:
Represent, solve, and justify solutions to single-step and multistep contextual problems by
applying strategies (e.g., estimation, properties of addition and multiplication) and algorithms,
including the standard algorithm, involving addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division
of whole numbers, with and without remainders, in which:

E8A0D13137A344E2B534E30F00085AED.description: Estimate the sum, difference, product, and quotient of whole numbers in contextual problems.

21572CF3DF9A4D72B42F2827BDA17206.description:
The student will estimate, represent, solve, and justify solutions to single-step and
multistep contextual problems using addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division
with whole numbers.

2FB335A1E596453CBF21B3F023CAD980.description: Determine the prime factorization for a whole number up to 100.

24AA79084678445B814BD36E3931D789.description:
Classify, compare, and contrast whole numbers up to 100 using the characteristics prime and
composite.

29FBEDBCAE8749A18D76C875A8A0DEA0.description:
Given a whole number up to 100, create a concrete or pictorial representation to demonstrate
whether the number is prime or composite, and justify reasoning.

ED679187D54D40EF9494058158243564.description:
The student will demonstrate an understanding of prime and composite numbers, and
determine the prime factorization of a whole number up to 100.

183646791FB44841B6F328B23DB8BE02.description:
Compare (using symbols <, >, =) and order (least to greatest and greatest to least) a set of no
more than four decimals and fractions (proper, improper) and/or mixed numbers using
multiple strategies (e.g., benchmarks, place value, number lines). Justify solutions orally, in
writing, or with a model.*

63165B00E39445C498A918FEEABDE755.description:
Identify equivalent relationships between decimals and fractions with denominators that are
thirds, eighths, and factors of 100 in their equivalent decimal form, with and without models.*

01EAA9A384ED4DDCAB2E708FD5BF26D5.description:
Use concrete and pictorial models to represent decimals in their equivalent fraction form
(thirds, eighths, and factors of 100).*

5C8CD7F891034F6FB18072408C18121D.description:
Use concrete and pictorial models to represent fractions with denominators that are thirds,
eighths, and factors of 100 in their equivalent decimal form.*

67066A5581B34BA9A4393CB9531061DA.description:
The student will use reasoning and justification to identify and represent equivalency
between fractions (with denominators that are thirds, eighths, and factors of 100) and
decimals; and compare and order sets of fractions (proper, improper, and/or mixed
numbers having denominators of 12 or less) and decimals (through thousandths).
